turns.content: Hello, am I speaking with Nalini Iyer? This is Priya calling from QuickLend Financial Services regarding your personal loan account.
Yes, this is Nalini... I've been meaning to call you, but my mother's been really ill and I've been taking care of her, it's been a tough time. Can this call wait, I'm at the hospital right now?

Nalini, I'm so sorry to hear that your mother is unwell, I hope she recovers soon. I understand this might not be the best time, but I do need to discuss your outstanding loan amount with you. Can you spare just a minute to talk about it, or would you prefer I call you back at a more convenient time?

My mother's condition is critical, and to be honest, I'm not even sure how I'm going to pay her medical bills, let alone the loan... Can't you people just give me some more time, or maybe waive off some of the interest?

Nalini, I completely understand your situation and I'm willing to work with you to find a solution. I can offer to temporarily suspend the interest accrual or restructure your loan into smaller, more manageable EMIs. Can you tell me a little more about your current financial situation, so I can see what options might be available to you?

You don't understand, I'm barely scraping by as a freelance writer, and my income is so unpredictable... I had to choose between paying the loan or my mother's hospital bills, and I couldn't just abandon her, could I?

Nalini, I do understand that it's been a tough decision for you, and family comes first. Let me see what I can do - I can offer a 3-6 month EMI deferment or a temporary reduction in your monthly payments. Would either of those options help you get back on your feet, and then we can revisit the loan repayment plan?

I don't know... it sounds like it might help, but I'm just so overwhelmed with everything right now... Can I talk to someone else, maybe someone who can make more decisions? I don't want to keep bothering you, Priya, you seem nice, but I just feel like I'm being pulled in so many directions...

Nalini, don't worry, I'm here to help, and I can definitely escalate this to my team lead if you'd like. Her name is Rachel, and she can review your account and see if there are any additional options available to you. Would you like me to transfer the call to her, or would you prefer I get her to call you back at a later time that's more convenient for you?

I don't know if I can even talk to someone else right now, I'm just feeling so overwhelmed and emotional... Can Rachel just call me back tomorrow or something? I need some time to think and try to get my head together, okay?

Nalini, that's completely understandable, and I'm so sorry you're feeling this way. I'll make a note to have Rachel call you back tomorrow, and we'll give you the space you need. Before we go, just to confirm, I'll send you a formal email with the details of our conversation, and Rachel will reach out to you tomorrow to discuss further. Is that okay with you?
Yes... that sounds okay, I guess. Just please, don't send any more letters or notices to my house, my mother is already stressed enough about my financial situation... [starting to cry]

Nalini, I'm so sorry, please don't worry, I'll make sure to put a hold on any further notices or letters being sent to your house. We'll work with you to find a solution, and I'll make sure Rachel is aware of your situation when she calls you tomorrow. Take care of yourself and your mother, and try to get some rest, okay? I'll talk to you soon.
[sniffling] Okay... thank you, Priya... just thank you for understanding... [AGREES TO PLAN]
